radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed Tomographic (CT) scan of the thorax
radiographic_examinations.findings: Consolidation in the right middle lobe.
New density in the right upper lobe.
Air-space opacities at the bases of both lungs.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Unchanged on the sixth hospital day.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed Tomographic (CT) scan of the thorax
radiographic_examinations.findings: Nodular air-space opacities up to 3 cm in diameter, with air bronchograms; small focus of air in an opacity in the right upper lobe suggesting early cavitation; diffuse ground-glass opacities.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On the sixth hospital day, more numerous lucent areas in the right upper lobe, consistent with the presence of cavitation.

radiographic_examinations.date: On the fourth day of hospitalization
radiographic_examinations.findings: Dense air-space opacities overlying the right hilar area and in the right lower lung, less dense nodular opacities in the left lung, and diffuse ground-glass opacities suggesting edema of the left lung.
